item.title: Faith add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Faith add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Faith add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Faith add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Faith add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Faith add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Faith add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Faith add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description:
"Mad Girl's Love Song
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my lids and all is born again. (I think I made you up inside my head.)
The stars go waltzing out in blue and red, And arbitrary blackness gallops in: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.
I dreamed that you bewitched me into bed And sung me moon-struck, kissed me quite insane. (I think I made you up inside my head.)
God topples from the sky, hell's fires fade: Exit seraphim and Satan's men: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.
I fancied you'd return the way you said, But I grow old and I forget your name. (I think I made you up inside my head.)
I should have loved a thunderbird instead; At least when spring comes they roar back again. I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead. (I think I made you up inside my head.)" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Faith add a quote by E. e. cummings
item.description:
"sweet spring is your time is my time is our time for springtime is lovetime and viva sweet love
(all the merry little birds are flying in the floating in the very spirits singing in are winging in the blossoming)
lovers go and lovers come awandering awondering but any two are perfectly alone there's nobody else alive
(such a sky and such a sun i never knew and neither did you and everybody never breathed quite so many kinds of yes)
not a tree can count his leaves each herself by opening but shining who by thousands mean only one amazing thing
(secretly adoring shyly tiny winging darting floating merry in the blossoming always joyful selves are singing)
sweet spring is your time is my time is our time for springtime is lovetime and viva sweet love" -- E. e. cummings

item.title: Faith add a quote by Catullus
item.description: "Vivamus, mea Lesbia, atque amemus, rumoresque senum severiorum omnes unius aestimemus assis! soles occidere et redire possunt; nobis cum semel occidit brevis lux, nox est perpetua una dormienda. da mi basia mille, deinde centum, dein mille altera, dein secunda centum, deinde usque altera mille, deinde centum; dein, cum milia multa fecerimus, conturbabimus illa, ne sciamus, aut ne quis malus invidere possit cum tantum sciat esse basiorum." -- Catullus

item.title: Faith add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths Of night and light and the half light, I would spread the cloths under your feet: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Faith add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description:
"Hold fast to dreams for if dreams die life is a broken-winged bird that can not fly.
Hold fast to dreams for when dreams go life is a barren field frozen with snow." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Faith add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description:
"I've known rivers: I've known rivers ancient as the world and older than the flow of human blood in human veins.
My soul has grown deep like the rivers.
I bathed in the Euphrates when dawns were young. I built my hut near the Congo and it lulled me to sleep. I looked upon the Nile and raised the pyramids above it. I heard the singing of the Mississippi when Abe Lincoln went down to New Orleans, and I've seen its muddy bosom turn all golden in the sunset.
I've known rivers: Ancient, dusky rivers.
My soul has grown deep like the rivers." -- Langston Hughes
